title: Business Live: FTSE at record high - BBC News
summary: government confirms energy price cap plans .
sky in strong q1 as shareholder revolt looms .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for thursday 's business live - thank you for staying with us .
we 'll be back again at 06:00 tomorrow , so do join us again if you can to get all the news , views and analysis from the world of business , money and economics .

documents.title: visitscotland to shut 39 tourist offices
text: nearly two-thirds of scotland 's tourist information centres are to close as part of `` radical '' plans to change the service .
visitscotland said 39 of its 65 centres would shut over the next two years , leaving 26 `` high-impact regional hubs '' .
explaining the decision , visitscotland said there had been a 58 % drop in the number of tourists visiting their information centres over the past 10 years .
two out of three visitors to scotland now get their information online , so they would be investing £ 10m in digital activity and the new regional hubs .
staff affected by the centre closures are to be offered redundancy packages or the chance of redeployment .
the centre at portree on skye is one which will be extended into a regional hub .
the centres and edinburgh and glasgow airports will be among those due to close .
read more here including which centres will close and where the new hubs will be located .

documents.title: bank woes drag down wall street
text: what a difference a day makes .
on wednesday , all three key us share indexes hit record highs .
on thursday , they all closed lower , following lacklustre quarterly results from jp morgan and citigroup .
the two banks beat profit and revenue estimates , but reported a fall in trading revenue .
jp morgan shares were down by 0.88 % , while citigroup lost 3.43 % .
the dow jones closed down 0.14 % at 22,841.01 , while the broader s & p 500 fell 0.17 % to 2,550.93 .
the tech-heavy nasdaq shed 0.18 % to close at 6,591.51 .

documents.title: trump : puerto rico aid ca n't continue ' forever '
text: us president donald trump has griped about emergency relief efforts in hurricane-ravaged puerto rico , saying federal aid can not continue `` forever '' .
in tweets , he accused puerto rico of a `` total lack of accountability '' , adding that `` electric and all infrastructure was disaster before hurricanes '' .
the island , whose 3.4 million residents are us citizens , is 90 % without power , some three weeks after hurricane maria .
congress is weighing a multi-billion dollar aid package for the territory .
lawmakers are expected to approve $ 36.5bn ( £ 28bn ) in emergency storm relief for puerto rico , florida , texas and the us virgin islands , as well as wildfire-ravaged california .
in thursday 's tweets , the us president noted it was up to `` congress to decide how much to spend '' .
but he added : `` we can not keep fema , the military & the first responders , who have been amazing ( under the most difficult circumstances ) in p.r .
forever ! ''
read more here

documents.title: rare rolex fetches £ 230,000
text: a rolex watch which was once rescued from a cement mixer has sold for £ 230,000 at auction .
auctioneers said the watch , which was originally purchased in 1965 , was one of the `` great rarities '' .
lockdales auctioneers said bidders had flown over from italy , the usa and the netherlands to take part in wednesday 's sale at martlesham heath , suffolk .
its estimated value was £ 8,000 .
the auctioneers said the market for vintage watches `` seems to be very hot '' .
read full story here

documents.title: sausage factory
text: who knew : germany has around 1,200 different types of sausage - just one of the fascinating facts bbc radio 4 has dug up .
frankfurters , bratwurst , munich weisswurst and hundreds more .
germany 's varieties of sausage far outnumber the many kinds of french cheese .
current estimates suggest that france can now offer around 400 cheeses .
this is still outnumbered three to one by german sausages .
read more here
the first ever oktoberfest happened # onthisday in 1810 .
fine out more plus a plethora of fascinating germanic facts :
@ twitterid @ twitterid
wow have i been here that long , guess i should go home now .
pissed up idiots .
nuff said .
time for a party ? ? !

documents.title: goldman buys 'flipping ' lender
text: home-flippers looking for cash to fuel their businesses have a new bank : goldman sachs .

the wall street journal reports that goldman has purchased los angeles-based genesis capital , which provides short-term loans to investors that buy , renovate and quickly resell distressed , single-family homes .
such rehabbers have relied heavily on private , non-bank lenders since the financial crisis , as banks shied away from risky investments .
goldman has been working to build up new revenue streams , as traditional money-makers such as bond trading face challenges .
the firm also started an online bank for consumers .
other major wall street firms , including affiliates of blackstone group and fortress investment , have made similar moves .
alternative asset manager oaktree capital management previously invested money in genesis .

wall street 's interest in rehabbers comes as a new paper for the national bureau of economic research argues that real estate investors were largely responsible for the rise in mortgage defaults in the us during the run-up to the financial crisis .
author: Natalie Sherman
New York business reporter

documents.title: scottish widows buys zurich business
text: edinburgh-based scottish widows is to take over the uk pensions and savings division built up by zurich .
the long-rumoured deal was announced on thursday by scottish widows ' parent company lloyds banking group .
it adds £ 15bn of assets under management to the £ 124bn already under management from the edinburgh office .
it also adds 500,000 customers .
two hundred zurich employees in cheltenham are expected to transfer to lloyds .

documents.title: treasury secretary 'applauds ' trump over obamacare
text: i applaud the president for taking this important step to relieve the american people of the burdens of the affordable care act ( aca ) .

this executive order will empower individuals and small businesses to improve their healthcare coverage , and unleash the power of the free market to increase accessibility , affordability , and options .
by reducing the regulatory barriers that limit choice and competition , we will make sure that americans have access to the healthcare coverage they deserve .

documents.title: trump signs order to weaken obamacare
text: us president donald trump has signed an executive order allowing the sale of health insurance plans that are exempt from some obamacare regulations .
the order directs federal agencies to consider easing rules allowing small businesses and some individuals to buy cheaper plans with fewer benefits .
consumers could also buy short-term policies that would skirt protections in place for pre-existing conditions .
the order comes after congress has repeatedly failed to repeal the law .

mr trump said the white house was `` starting the process '' of repealing and replacing the affordable care act , known as obamacare , in announcing the executive order at a news conference on thursday .
read more here

documents.title: facebook 'fully committed ' providing details of ads
text: let 's get a bit more detail on facebook boss sheryl sandbeg 's comments about ads bought in russia during the us election ( see post at 2:38pm ) .
on 11 october , ms sandberg and others from facebook appeared before us congressional panels looking into reports of russian interference in the election .
today she told the news site axios that facebook was `` fully committed '' to providing detailed information about the ads .
the ads , pages they linked to and who they were targeted at have been given to investigators , said ms sandberg .
the ads and the fake accounts used to get them on facebook had been found and removed , she said .
however , she added , if the ads had been placed by real accounts , facebook would not have removed them .
read the full story from our technology team here

documents.title: swiss investigate former fifa boss again
text: prosecutors in switzerland say they 've opened a second criminal investigation into the former secretary general of football 's world governing body , fifa , reports bbc world service .
they 're investigating jerome valcke on sus of receiving what they call undue advantages from two businessmen over the awarding of media rights for forthcoming world cups .
one of the men has been named as the qatari , nasser al-khelaifi , who 's the chairman of paris st-germain football club .
mr valcke is the subject of another swiss investigation that began last year .
he denies wrongdoing .
mr khelaifi has yet to respond to the allegations .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: equifax sit faces another attack
text: equifax has taken down a customer help web page amid reports of another attack on the credit reporting giant .
the firm said it took down the link for credit report assistance temporarily `` out of an abundance of caution '' .
it said its it and security teams are investigating the incident .
equifax is still reeling from its discovery of a breach that compromised personal data of more than 145.5 million americans and about 8,000 canadians .
equifax has also said a file containing names and birthdates of 15.2m people in the uk were accessed .
the new attack involved a webpage that asked visitors to download fraudulent adobe flash updates , according to ars technica .
the issue was first publicly identified by an independent security analyst .
`` we are aware of the situation identified on the equifax.com website in the credit report assistance link , '' spokesman wyatt jefferies wrote .
`` when it becomes available or we have more information to share , we will . ''
author: Natalie Sherman
New York business reporter

documents.title: pound jumps against the euro
text: the pound also jumped against the euro following the reports in the german newspaper handelsblatt that the eu could offer the uk a transitional brexit deal ( see previous post ) .
a short while ago the pound was at 1.1193 euros .

documents.title: pound hits eight-week high against dollar
text: sterling jumped by more than a cent to reach an eight-day high against the dollar on thursday .
reports said it was buoyed by a report in germany 's handelsblatt newspaper that the european union could offer britain a two-year transitional brexit deal .
earlier the pound had fallen sharply after the eu 's chief brexit negotiator michel barnier said negotiations about the uk 's divorce payment had become deadlocked .
the pound subsequently went down to $ 1.3122 , but after the handelsblatt report it rebounded to reach $ 1.3267 , a rise of 0.3 % .

documents.title: read : check it out
text: the bbc 's reality check team delves into the us president 's economic claims .
we look at some of the latest economic claims from @ twitterid
under obama , market cap increased by largest amount ever .
this alone dislocates any link with debt .
can republicans read ?
bho raised national debt to 9 trillion , exceeding all presidents .
corrupt pols ' entitlement minds spend other peoples ' money like thieves .

documents.title: starmer : brexit deadlock a 'serious failure '
text: the shadow brexit secretary has said that the deadlock in the talks with the european union over the uk 's withdrawal is `` a serious failure to hit a very important deadline . ''
sir keir was talking as the european union 's brexit negotiator , michel barnier confirmed insufficient progress had been made for discussions on a future trade deal to begin .
the brexit secretary , david davis , insisted considerable headway had been made .

sir keir told radio 4 's world at one that `` it 's blindingly obvious that we 're not going to reach a full agreement by march 2019 and unless there 's a transitional arrangement in place soon , then companies are making plans about what they will do in the event of a no deal '' .
he added `` a no deal is very bad for britain and for the eu '' .
author: The World at One
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: ryanair recruits pilots
text: last month ryanair announced it was cancelling thousands of flights blaming a mix-up over pilots ' holiday rotas .
at the time past and present ryanair pilots blamed a lack of pilots .
ryanair boss micheal o'leary insisted there was no shortage .
nevertheless , the airline is tweeting about how well its pilot recruitment is going .
45 more pilots joined ryanair today .
the total number for 2017 is now over 860 .
read more in the link

documents.title: ftse 's 'winning streak ' continues
text: more on the ftse 100 's record high close the index often benefits from a fall in sterling , as a weaker currency increases the value of companies ' overseas earnings when they are brought back to the uk and converted back into pounds .
`` the uk stock market continues its winning streak despite concerns over economic performance and the unfolding brexit process , '' said laith khalaf , senior analyst at hargreaves lansdown .
`` the question is whether the market 's strong run means it 's fit to burst . ''

he added that it was `` vital to recognise that the level of the footsie is not a measure of value in uk stocks , seeing as it does n't take account of the level of earnings of companies in the index .
`` basing investment decisions on the level of the ftse is therefore like deciding whether to buy something based on its price , without actually knowing what the item is , '' he added .

documents.title: why is the ftse 100 at record high ?
text: analysts say the ftse 100 's record high is mainly to the fall in the pound .
the bullish move was achieved for the wrong reasons , as the dip in the pound on the back of the stalled brexit talks helped the british index .

documents.title: ftse ends at new high
text: the ftse 100 has closed at a record high of 7,556.24 points , partly following a fall in sterling sparked by concerns about the state of brexit negotiations .

documents.title: ryanair to challenge air berlin deal
text: ryanair has said it will refer lufthansa 's 210m euro deal to buy large parts of insolvent air berlin ( see earlier posts ) to european union competition authorities .
`` we will be referring the matter to the eu competition authority in due course , '' a ryanair spokesman told reuters .
the irish airline had previously described the lufthansa deal to snap up bits of air berlin as a `` a stitch-up '' .

documents.title: cwu says strike 'inevitable ' without 'good ' agreement
text: the company are deluded if they believe their court room politics will resolve this dispute .
instead the company 's actions will have the complete opposite effect .
postal workers ' attitude towards the company will harden and it makes us more determined than ever to defend our members pensions , jobs , service and achieve our objectives .
unless the company significantly shifts its position on a range of issues and we can quickly conclude a good agreement for our members then strike action is inevitable .

documents.title: postal union 'disappointed ' at strike injunction
text: the communication workers union ( cwu ) says it 's `` extremely disappointed '' that the royal mail has won a high court injunction to prevent next week 's 48-hour strike .
it described royal mail 's action as `` nothing more than a desperate delaying tactic from a board who are increasingly out of touch with the views of its workforce '' .

in a statement , the cwu went on to say that it had `` nothing to fear from mediation and unless there is significant movement from the company on a range of issues and a satisfactory agreement is concluded , the union will be calling further strike action once the mediation process has been completed .

documents.title: lagarde ' can not imagine ' brexit without trade deal
text: the managing director of the imf , christine lagarde , has said that she `` can not imagine '' britain leaving the european union without a new , bespoke trade deal .

speaking at the imf 's autumn meeting in washington dc , mme lagarde said that world trade organisation rules had little to say on rights of citizens for example or on freedom of the skies agreements allowing airlines to fly across the continent .

answering my question on what the economic impact of a `` no deal '' scenario would be , mme largarde said that the uk and the eu were so intertwined there would need to be a `` specific approach '' taken - a signal that she does not believe a `` no deal '' world trade organisation relationship is sustainable .
she said it would be difficult for `` the people '' across europe to understand that approach .
the government has made it clear that the `` no deal '' option is still on the table , despite it wanting a bespoke trade agreement with the eu once the brexit process is complete .
author: Kamal Ahmed
Economics editor

documents.title: why are postal workers in dispute ?
text: postal workers who are members of the communication workers union ( cwu ) were due to strike for 48 hours in a dispute over pensions , pay and jobs .
if the strike had gone ahead it would have been the first national walkout since royal mail was privatised four years ago .
royal mail said that the cwu should enter into mediation before taking part in any industrial action .
the union said it had been trying to resolve the dispute for 18 months .

documents.title: breakingroyal mail wins strike injunction
text: the royal mail has won a high court injunction preventing next week 's 48-hour strike by postal workers .

documents.title: virgin invests in hyperloop one
text: richard branson 's virgin group has pumped an undisclosed amount of investment into the futuristic transport system , hyperloop one , one of several firms trying to create a pod-based transport system .
hyperloop puts pods in an airless tunnel and seeks to accelerate them to very high speeds to cut travel times for freight and passengers .
backers of the hyperloop idea claim that eventually the pods will travel at speeds of about 1,000 km/h .

in a statement mr branson described it as `` an incredibly innovative and exciting new way to move people and things at airline speeds on the ground '' , adding that the company would be rebranded as virgin hyperloop one .

documents.title: how will gucci make its shoes now ?
text: the ft 's katie martin has an idea :
gucci going fur free .
maybe it will have to use trump 's hair for its shoes in future .
is this a naked attraction thing again ?
dunno .
i think you watch it more than i do now anyway
i thought you said you sky+ it every week ?

documents.title: oh we do like to go to the uk
text: there were a record 19.2 million visits to the uk in the first half of this year , up 9 % on the same period last year , according to new figures from visit britain .
the tourist promotion agency predicted earlier this week that it expects 2017 as a whole to be a new record , with nearly 40 million overseas people expected to visit the country .
aside from the weak pound , what 's luring them all here ?
according to the assocation of leading visitor attractions it 's mainly london 's top quality museums .
top five uk visitor attractions in 2016 were :

documents.title: breakingpolice reopen weinstein probe
text: new york police said thursday they have reopened a investigation into allegations of a 2004 sexual assault by disgraced movie mogul harvey weinstein .

an avalanche of claims of sexual harassment , assault and rape by the hollywood heavyweight have surfaced since the publication last week of an explosive new york times report alleging a history of abusive behaviour dating back decades .

documents.title: wall street opens lower
text: all three key us stock indexes opened lower on thursday , despite both jp morgan and citigroup kicking off the bank results season by reporting a rise in profits .
a short while ago the dow jones was at 22,838.63 , a fall of 34 points or 0.15 % .
the s & p 500 was a 2,549.59 , that 's 6 points or 0.22 % lower .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq was down 17 points of 0.26 % at 6,586.62 .

documents.title: facebook boss : 'things happened that should n't have '
text: facebook 's chief operating officer sheryl sandberg has said the company was fully committed to helping us congressional investigators publicly release russia-backed political ads that ran during the 2016 us election .
ms sandberg told the axios news website that `` things happened on our platform in this election that should n't have happened . ''
last week facebook said about 10 million people in the us saw facebook adverts bought in russia before and after the us presidential election .
it said most ads focused on `` divisive social and political messages '' on issues like immigration and gun rights .
russia has denied trying to influence the election .

documents.title: lufthansa buys parts of air berlin
text: lufthansa has agreed to buy parts of insolvent german airline air berlin for around 210m euros , air berlin has confirmed .
the deal includes air berlin 's austrian leisure travel airline niki , its lg walter regional airline and 20 further aircraft , its said in a statement .
the deal still needs to be given the go-ahead by the european commission .
negotiations with britain 's easyjet for other parts of the business are ongoing , air berlin said

documents.title: shell boosts electric charging network
text: royal dutch shell is to take over newmotion , the owner of one of europe 's biggest electric vehicle charging networks .

shell has started providing charging points for electric vehicles at some of its retail stations and said the acquisition of newmotion would help it offer electric vehicle services at home , at work and on the go .

`` today 's announcement is an early step towards ensuring customers can access a range of refuelling choices over the coming decades , '' said matthew tipper , shell 's vice president for new fuels .
newmotion has more than 30,000 electric charging points in the netherlands , germany , france and britain .

documents.title: breakingjames murdoch reappointed at sky
text: james murdoch has survived an attempt by shareholders to oust him as chairman of british broadcaster sky .
shareholders voted 78 % in favour of his re-appointment , although he only had the backing of 50.5 % of independent shareholders , the company said .
that is an improvement on last year when 53 % of independent investors - i.e .
excluding the stake held by the murdoch-controlled 21st century fox - voted against his re-election .

documents.title: citigroup profits rise
text: us bank citigroup - well-known in the uk for its canary wharf skyscraper - is the second wall street titan to report profit growth .
it said third quarter net income rose 8 % to $ 4.1bn - after jp morgan also reported an increase in profits .
the profit figure was flattered by the sale of its fixed income analytics business .
without the sale , net income would actually have fallen by 2 % .
nonetheless , chief executive michael corbat hailed it as `` a strong quarter '' .

`` we had revenue increases in many of the products we have been investing in , tightly managed our expenses , and again saw loan growth in both our consumer and institutional businesses , '' he says .

documents.title: slip or fall ?
text: the pound is back below €1.10 - having fallen more than 0.6 % after michel barnier said there was a `` deadlock '' over what britain would pay when it leaves the eu .
sterling is also down 0.6 % against the dollar .
foreign exchange service worldfirst tweets :
downgrading sterling 's performance today from a 'slip ' to a 'fall '
wake me up when it 's a 'tactical buy ' again
that 's just before people `` go constructive ''
lol !
davis has been constructive since last summer
meaning i can upgrade # ftse100 from brexit deadlock inspired creep north to breakout .
highest since early jun , 35pts from record highs

documents.title: why is the pound lower ?
text: currency traders are watching the progress of the brexit talks - and the rhetoric used by both sides - very closely .
the fall in the pound after eu chief negotiator michel barnier 's comments about a `` deadlock '' on the divorce bill is the latest example , analysts said .
the uk had hoped the eu might agree to open trade talks when it meets at a crucial summit next week .
andrew lilico - a director at consultancy europe economics , who backs brexit - says mr barnier 's comments have made it less likely that the talks will progress this month .
mkts also trade on probabilities not central cases , so a 10 % chance of talks proceeding in oct getting crystallised to 0 makes a difference .

documents.title: apple gets go-ahead for data centre
text: tech giant apple has won a court case giving it the go-ahead to build a new data centre in the west of ireland .
the project , first announced in 2015 , had been delayed due to planning objections .
but the high court has now dismissed the environmental challenge made by three people .

documents.title: pound slips further
text: the pound `` reacted poorly '' to comments from the eu 's chief negotiator that there 's a `` deadlock '' over the brexit divorce bill , according to analysts .
it 's now down 0.6 % against the dollar and the euro , making £ 1 worth just over $ 1.31 and €1.08 .
`` these comments overshadowed [ michel ] barnier 's claim that 'decisive progress is within our grasp over the next two months ' , '' said spreadex analyst connor campbell .

documents.title: paperchase under pressure from rivals
text: stationery chain paperchase , managed to grow sales 4.3 % to £ 11.9.2m in its 201-6-17 financial year .
but overall earnings fell 16.2 % to £ 9.1m due to the cost of goods rising and as it cut prices to compete with new rivals such as kikki.k and typo .
sarah johns , retail analyst at globaldata , says she expects the threat from discounters as well as new entrants to continue to put pressure on paperchase 's profits .
`` ensuring the product remains desirable and that paperchase is able to justify its price points by showcasing quality will soften this threat , '' she adds .

documents.title: bitcoin hits all-time high
text: tech correspondent rory cellan-jones tweets :
bitcoin soars above $ 5000 again to new record high

documents.title: jp morgan shrugs off trading slump
text: wall street giant jp morgan has kicked off the earnings season for us banks with a rise in profits for the third quarter .
the bank said net income was up 7 % to $ 6.7bn in the period - despite taking a hit in its trading and investment banking arm .
profits in that unit fell 13 % .
next up will be citigroup this afternoon , followed by wells fargo tomorrow and morgan stanley next week .

documents.title: just in case you were wondering
text: hsbc 's new boss john flint is not in any way related to douglas flint , the bank 's outgoing chairman .
the new boss is a hsbc lifer .

he joined the bank 's international manager '' training programme in 1989 and subsequently spent more than 14 years in asia , where the bank makes more than three-quarters of its profit , before taking up senior roles in the uk .

text: want to know where in the country you can afford to live ?
click on the link below to find out .
young first-time buyers are increasing their overall mortgage debt in order to tackle short-term financial pressures
how much do you spend on housing compared to your grandparents ?

documents.title: what barnier said
text: this week 's fifth round of talks are the final discussions before a crucial eu summit on 19 and 20 october .

the uk had been hoping eu leaders at the summit would decide enough progress has been made to open trade talks - but michel barnier says he wo n't be recommending that `` we start discussions on future relations '' at the summit .
the eu 's chief brexit negotiator says there have been `` no great steps forward '' and brexit talks are in `` deadlock '' .
read more here

documents.title: pound hit by barnier comments
text: the pound has abruptly reversed direction after the eu 's chief negotiator michel barnier said there has not been enough progress to move to the next stage of brexit talks .
the pound is down almost half a cent at $ 1.3170 after the comments , representing a 0.3 % fall .
barnier - no great steps forward .
will talk about future relationship `` when the time comes '' - ie not yet .
barnier - i will not recommend we move to future relationship at next round in december .
no surprise here , i would not recommend this either .

documents.title: draft energy cap bill published
text: the draft legislation designed to lower the cost of energy bills , has now been published by the government - all 38 pages of it .
the draft domestic gas and electricity ( tariffs cap ) bill will give energy regulator ofgem the power to cap standard variable tariffs .

one of the facts in the document , courtesy of energy regulator ofgem , is that the average bill for a ty dual fuel household on a standard variable tariff with one of the `` big six '' suppliers was £ 1,142 .
in contrast the cheapest tariff available over the same period was £ 824 , a difference of £ 318.3 so clearly there are savings to be made .

documents.title: hsbc 's new chief 'humbled '
text: john flint , the man taking over at hsbc , will be responsible for a bank with 230,000 staff worldwide and a market value of £ 150bn .
he 'll become one of the most powerful men in banking when he takes over in february .
so how does he feel ?
`` humbled '' and `` enormously excited '' , he says .
hsbc 's chairman mark tucker adds that mr flint has a great understanding of `` hsbc 's heritage , and the passion to build the bank for the next generation '' .
mr flint is replacing stuart gulliver , who is retiring after seven years at the top of the uk 's biggest bank .

documents.title: uniqlo owner 's bet pays off
text: uniqlo owner fast retailing has invested heavily in overseas expansion amid a struggling japanese economy - a bet which seems to have paid off .

the firm said its operating profit for the year to the end of august was 176.4bn yen ( £ 1.2bn ) and singled out uniqlo international for an especially strong increase in profit , which proved the key driver of overall group performance . ''

documents.title: breakinghsbc names new boss
text: hsbc , the uk 's biggest bank , has named john flint as its next chief executive , sticking with its model of promoting company insiders to run the firm .
mr flint , who currently runs hsbc 's retail and wealth management business , will start his new role in february next year .
he 'd been widely tipped to take the role .
the appointment marks the first major decision from the bank 's new chairman , mark tucker , who joined hsbc at the start of the month as its first ever externally-appointed chairman .

documents.title: rejoice !
text: at last !
some good news the uk rapeseed crop is 23 % higher this year at 2.18 million tonnes due to a sharp rise in yields , according to defra .
rapeseed yields increased by 26.5 % to 3.9 tonnes a hectare , while the crop area was 2.8 % lower at 563,000 hectares , the ministry said .
bet you ca n't wait to tell your colleagues that fascinating fact
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: tfl will defend uber decision - sadiq khan
text: london mayor sadiq khan has just said the city 's transport regulator will defend its decision in court not to renew uber 's taxi operator licence .
uber has until tomorrow to file an appeal - and has said it will take transport for london ( tfl ) to court over the decision .

`` the courts now will consider the appeal from uber and of course tfl will defend the decision they made , '' mr khan , who is tfl 's chairman , said during a monthly question time session , according to reuters .

documents.title: credit crunch ?
text: the bank of england has sounded the alarm throughout the year about rising household debt .
and it looks like banks are listening .
lenders expect the availability of unsecured credit - i.e .
not mortgages or car loans - to reach its lowest level since 2008 in the next three months , according to the bank .
the criteria for granting credit cards and other unsecured loans were tightened in the three months to september , it said .
the proportion of unsecured credit applications being approved also `` fell significantly '' .
the largest % of lenders since 08 plan to reduce unsecured credit supply .
consumption will remain weak even as the real wage squeeze eases
i would n't want to bet against the great british borrower maybe they 'll just pay more for their credit ?

documents.title: record high for s korea shares
text: stocks in seoul extended recent gains to hit a fresh record on thursday , buoyed by another strong finish on wall street .
the kospi index ended up 0.7 % at 2,475 points .
confidence is high going into earnings season and heavyweight samsung is expected to reveal strong profits when its delivers quarterly results on friday .
the upbeat mood was matched in tokyo , where the nikkei 225 index is still trading at levels not seen in more than two decades .
it rose 0.4 % to end at 20,955 .
elsewhere in asia , australia 's s & p/asx 200 added 0.4 % and hong kong 's hang seng also put on 0.4 % in afternoon trading .

documents.title: just eat deal 'by end of the year '
text: takeaway firm just eat is zooming towards completing its takeover of uk rival hungryhouse by the end of the year , according to analysts at investec .
the £ 240m deal received preliminary approval from competition regulators today .
that paves the way for the takeover to get formal approval in late november , says david amiras at investec .
just eat is likely to see profits rise by 7 % next year after it combines with hungryhouse , he adds .

documents.title: oil price 'unlikely to rise next year '
text: the oil price is down slightly this morning , with brent crude currently 32 cents lower at $ 56.62 a barrel .
in its latest monthly update , the international energy agency says prices are unlikely to grow much further .

`` taking 2018 as a whole , oil demand and non-opec production will grow by roughly the same volume and it is this current outlook that might act as the ceiling for aspirations of higher oil prices , '' it says .

documents.title: worst case scenario ?
text: the cabinet has been dominated this week by how the uk should prepare for a brexit `` no deal '' .
that 's where the uk would walk away without an eu trade deal , or transitional arrangements , after brexit talks finish in march 2019 .
the british exporters association - which represents major manufacturers including rolls-royce and airbus and dozens of small firms - also has some concerns .
a 'no deal ' on brexit wd be a `` worst case '' says boss of british exporters association @ twitterid
odd comment : exports to non eu countries are soaring .
any chance bbc might start interviewing optimistic brexiteers & stop doomongering
food & drink exporters association also conversing with government later this month .
@ twitterid
given the government have been claiming 'no deal is better than a bad deal ' - what is the bad deal ?
nuclear armageddon ?
replace the word worse '' with best '' again a remoaner failing to grasp the gravity and core issue governing brexit !
it is not about economics it is an existentially driven concept !
economic consequences good or bad being utterly irrelevant !
which no one seems to get !
worst case for who though ?
is this the r4 ass political editor re-tweeting his own tweets on the bbc r4 twitter account .
so why are boris and his loony mates getting more traction .
pm needs to slap them down .
we need a deal .
clearly it 's possible to construct a deal that is worse than no deal .
so strictly speaking that ca n't be accurate .
the bbc consistently under reports or downplays bad news in countries .
how many of their economies are .
norman .
business loves status quo and will campaign for it .
your lack of insight or apparent lack is very telling .
business will find a way .
and again , the never ending stream of anti brexit stories continues .
logic tells you that a 'bad deal ' would be the 'worst case ' .
simples !

documents.title: sky deal or no deal ?
text: `` pretty solid '' , is how etx capital analyst neil wilson sums up sky 's first quarter results .
but he points out that the results are pretty irrelevant given the current investigation by the competition and markets authority which is probing the firm 's takeover by 21st century fox .
`` the softness in the share price - at £ 9.18 it 's well below the £ 10.75 offer price - suggests they [ investors ] do n't hold out much hope of success , '' he says .

documents.title: lufthansa to buy parts of air berlin
text: lufthansa plans to sign a deal today to buy parts of insolvent german airline air berlin .
lufthansa chief executive carsten spohr - who is in berlin to secure the deal - said it was `` a milestone in the history of lufthansa and air berlin . ''
air berlin , which is still flying after a 150m euro ( £ 130m ) rescue loan from germany 's government , said last month that a deal could help 80 % of its staff .
a reuters report suggests that lufthansa will buy air berlin 's niki leisure unit , its lg walter regional airline and some additional short-haul aircraft .

documents.title: stay in bed
text: it 's no doubt too late if you 're reading this , but the market 's performance so far means you may as well hit the snooze button .
spreadex analyst connor campbell says so far it 's looking like `` another dreary morning of trading '' .
the ftse 100 has barely moved , it 's currently up 0.04 % at 7537.18 .
the biggest winner is burberry , up 2.4 % , boosted by deutsche bank which has raised its target price on the fashion house by 40p to 1,843p .

documents.title: n brown bucks the trend
text: n brown , the owner of plus-size clothing brands simply be and jacamo , says sales rose 6 % in the first half of the year .
simply be was the `` standout performer '' with 21 % sales growth .
`` we made significant ladieswear market share gains against what remains a subdued consumer backdrop , '' says chief executive angela spindler .
the company says it plans to partner with amazon fashion , middle eastern online clothing retailer namshi and high street chain debenhams to expand its online business .
but investors are n't blown away by the results - shares in n brown are down 2 % at the start of trading .

documents.title: ftse flat again
text: in the first few minutes of trading , it 's looking like another uneventful day for the ftse .
so far the blue-chip index is pretty much flat at 7,533.81 .

documents.title: just eat deal gets green light
text: just eat 's £ 200m plan to take over rival food delivery service hungryhouse has been provisionally cleared by the competition and markets authority ( cma ) .
the cma was worried that the combination of the two companies could mean worse terms for the restaurants .
both companies take online orders from customers and act as delivery middle men between them and restaurants .
just eat says the cma 's final decision should be published next month .

documents.title: hays ' fees jump 10 %
text: uk recruitment firm hays has reported a 10 % jump in net fees in the three months to the end of september .
fees in germany rose 15 % , while asia jumped 14 % , but growth in the uk was far more muted with a rise of just 1 % .
brexit-related uncertainty knocked uk hiring at hays - and rivals such as pagegroup and robert walters - in the immediate aftermath of the eu vote .
`` looking ahead , conditions remain good in the vast majority of our international markets .
in the uk , market conditions remain stable overall , '' says chief executive alistair cox .

documents.title: booker sees sales and profit rise
text: booker , the wholesaler that has agreed to a £ 3.7bn takeover by tesco , has reported a 9 % rise in first half profit , driven by progress in both catering and retail .
pre-tax profit was £ 88m for the 24 weeks to 8 september , up from £ 81m for the same period last year , while sales rose 2.5 % to £ 2.6bn .
booker said it expected the tesco deal , currently being probed by competition regulators , to be done by early next year .

documents.title: wh smith travel shops rule
text: wh smith has hailed a milestone in the business as its travel business , basically its airport and railway station shops , has overtaken its high street business .
the chain says travel is now the largest part of the group in both revenue and profit , with the division 's full year profit up 10 % to £ 96m representing over 60 % of the group 's trading profit .
on the high street it 's a far less rosy with revenue down 5 % for the year , but the division managed to cut costs by a further £ 12m .

documents.title: sky reports rising sales ; adds customers
text: sky appears to have enjoyed a solid start to its financial year .
for the three months to the 30 september it reported a 5 % increase in sales to £ 3.3bn .
its measure of profit was up 15 % at £ 606m .
it added 160,000 new customers in its first quarter , up more than 50 % .

`` looking ahead , despite the uncertainty in the broader consumer environment , we remain on track with our plans and enter the busy q2 trading period focused on delivering our clear strategy for growth , '' jeremy darroch , group chief executive said .
the company holds its agm later today .

documents.title: government confirms energy cap plans
text: the department for business , energy and industrial strategy has confirmed that it plans to publish a draft bill to cap energy prices later .
`` the bill would require ofgem to consult and impose the cap as soon as practicable after the legislation is passed , '' it says in a statement .
it says the cap would be `` a temporary measure '' lasting until 2020 .
as we reported yesterday , the price cap is unlikely to take effect before winter .
the legislative process could take as long as a year , and then a further five months for energy regulator ofgem to implement a cap .

documents.title: status quo bias
text: are you suffering from `` status quo bias '' .
it 's how psychologists describe the fact that people just ca n't be bothered to change for example energy provider or bank .
claire levison from manchester university , says `` the default option is the easiest one to follow '' .
most people , she says , feel they just do n't have enough time to ring up or search on the internet to instigate change .
and even if they do manage to do that , the wide range of options means it 's difficult .
`` the more choices you give people the harder it is to come to a decision .

`` there is research to say that perhaps companies that are trying to keep customers offer lots of choices because they 're aware confusing customers will make them less likely to change , '' she says .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: gucci sheds the fur
text: luxury fashion brand gucci will go fur-free from next year , the company 's boss has said .
the italian fashion house will make the changes from the brand 's spring-summer 2018 collection and auction off all of its remaining animal fur items .
the change means gucci will no longer use mink , coyote , raccoon dog , fox , rabbit and all others species specially bred or caught .
campaigners have hailed the move as a `` huge game-changer '' in the fashion world .

documents.title: sky needs an 'independent ' chairman
text: should james murdoch stand down if a majority of independent shareholders vote against his election as chairman ?
`` i think he should , but i doubt very much that he will , '' said stephen clapham of beyond the balance sheet.com .
`` i think the best thing for the company would be to have an independent person in place . ''
how is the sky business performing ?
`` it used to be thought of as a fantastically well run company . ''
but he says that sky has changed the way it reports some important performance numbers to analysts , which mr clapham says has `` cost them a lot of friends in the city '' .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: energy price cap details
text: breakfast has all the details on the energy price cap announcement expected to be officially announced at 7am .
the government is expected to announce a cap on energy prices for 12 million households this morning .
@ twitterid has all the details
now where have i heard that idea before ?
that 's right - marxist miliband .
but daily mail says it 's ok now that it 's theresa 's policy
and make it more expensive for everyone else !
could always switch to exit fees paid , green renewable energy & fantastic service .
rated no1 on trustpilot .
just move .
im now saving £ £ s with bulb energy !
# renewable & got £ 50 credit + they pay your exit fees move b4 chill
the last time the gov played with a cap was tuition fees , now most uni`s now charge at the max capped level , you know what`s going to happen .
never mind that , how 's the comic book shop fairing these days , stuart
the biggest problem we have as customers is direct debit .
why are we penalised when we want to pay when get the bills direct debit is con .
surely it is only right that stupid lazy poor people that ca n't be bothered to change their energy provider should subsidise the rest of it
i agree too
everyone increases prices yearly , gas , elec , water , telecoms ect , is it because there is a need to , or just because its the norm and they can ?
perhaps they will do the same for food , petrol and house prices next ?
i wo n't hold my breath
about time , same every year just before christmas usually .
get the usual letter stating why .
wow !
they 'll be grinding us down for cattle feed soon .

documents.title: samsung heir starts appeal
text: the heir to south korea 's samsung group , lee jae-yong , has made his first public appearance since he was sentenced in august to five years in prison for corruption .
lee , who has denied all charges , is appealing the sentence .

the 49-year-old is accused of giving donations worth 41bn won ( $ 36m ; £ 29m ) to non-profit foundations operated by choi soon-sil , a friend of south korea 's former president park geun-hye , in return for political favours .
the appeal court is expected to rule on the case by february next year .

documents.title: james murdoch in 'difficult ' situation
text: sky holds its annual meeting of shareholders , and there are calls for james murdoch , son of the founder rupert murdoch , to stand down as chairman .
the murdoch interests have enough votes to make sure james murdoch stays as chairman , but some think that if a majority of independent shareholders vote against him , then james should stand down .
stephen martin is the director general of the institute of directors .
he says the problem revolves around the proposed takeover of sky by 21st century fox .
james murdoch is the chief executive of 21st century fox and the chairman of sky .
`` the issue is the lack of independence .
james is in a difficult situation because he is currently chief executive of the controlling shareholder and also he 's the chairman of sky so there is a conflict , potentially , there . ''
`` mr murdoch [ james ] has done a great job , there 's no question about that , the issue is on independence . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'pale , stale and male '
text: `` pale , stale and male , '' is often how firms ' senior staff are described .
while the boards of the uk 's top firms are beginning to be less male thanks to a big focus on gender diversity , just 8 % of ftse 100 directors are black or from an ethnic minority .
sir john parker , who has been looking at the issue for the government , says there 's still a `` long way to go '' .
`` the demographics are changing very rapidly .
currently about 14 % of the uk population are ethnically diverse by 2050 that will be 30 % . ''
he says it is in firms ' interest to improve their staff diversity to remain competitive for customers .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: will energy cap push up fixed deal prices ?
text: plans for draft legislation for a plan to cap energy bill standard variable charges for an extra 12 million consumers are expected to be unveiled later .

steve smith , director of energy switching firm flipper , says the cap is `` quite likely '' to push up fixed fees : `` a regulated price means people will switch off and think 'the government 's looking after me ' '' .
he says it 's clear that energy regulator ofgem is being told to implement the cap by the government and that a cap is against the advice of of the competition and markets authority .
`` it could actually do harm to competition and means many customers will end up paying a lot more .
`` if two thirds of the market is covered by a cap you start to question whether it 's a market at all , '' he says .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: small firms shrug off brexit fears
text: the british chambers of commerce is hosting its international trade summit in birmingham today , with the aim of looking at opportunities post brexit .
paul lindley , founder of babyfood business ella 's kitchen , says he 's confident the firm will continue to grow .
`` if you 've got a business that works in your home market .
if market conditions are right elsewhere and consumers like it here then they 're likely to like it there , '' he says .
he says small firms like his only survive by being adaptable and believes that will continue post brexit .
julianne ponan , founder of superfoods snacks firm creative nature , says so far the brexit vote `` has opened more doors for us '' .
`` even though the exchange rate is low people are able to buy more .
we 've expanded into iceland and dubai , '' she says .
however , she says the cost of her raw materials has increased .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: kobe steel crisis deepens
text: the boss of kobe steel has warned the list of affected products could increase as its internal investigation continues .
there are products which we have our doubts about '' said hiroya kawasaki , chief executive of kobe steel .

the firm - which has admitted fabricating quality data , possibly for as long as a decade - is now checking all its divisions , including those overseas , to see if the problem is more widespread than first realised .
general motors , boeing and toyota are among the firms checking their models to see if they used any substandard materials .

documents.title: good morning
text: we 've got results out from sky , booker group and wh smiths later this morning .
sky chair and 21st century fox chief executive james murdoch 's position is being questioned by three advisory firms who are calling on shareholders to rebel against his dual role .
fox is attempting to buy sky , which investors argue presents a conflict of interest for mr murdoch .
and there 'll be a renewed focus on energy prices again with the government expected to unveil draft legislation so it is able to enforce a broader price cap .
stay with us .
